sanskrit_verse:
क्रव्यादांस्तु मृगान् हत्वा धेनुं दद्यात्पयस्विनीम् ।
अक्रव्यादान् वत्सतरीमुष्ट्रं हत्वा तु कृष्णलम् ॥ ११.१३७॥
transliteration:
kravyādāṃstu mṛgān hatvā dhenuṃ dadyātpayasvinīm |
akravyādān vatsatarīmuṣṭraṃ hatvā tu kṛṣṇalam || 11.137||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who consumes flesh must, upon taking the life of a deer, offer in return a milk-giving cow; one who abstains from flesh, having slain a she-calf or a donkey, shall give a black bull.
jurisprudential_principles: Causation is tied to consumption and its sacrificial balance
Capacity-based responsibility aligns with dietary choice and ritual consequence
Restoration logic demands proportional energetic compensation
Consciousness alignment requires offering that sustains life-force
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent consumes meat AND kills deer THEN obligation = provide lactating cow
IF agent abstains from meat AND kills calf OR donkey THEN obligation = provide black bull
Obligation type determined by consumption status at time of act
Restitution value mapped to life-sustaining capacity of returned offering
Non-compliance triggers consciousness-realignment protocol until completion
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating acts involving animal life-taking, the court must determine the actor's habitual dietary pattern as determinant of restitution class. The hierarchy of offerings reflects ontological valuation of life-force sustaining potential. Responsibility thresholds are calibrated not by species killed but by the metabolic and spiritual exchange enacted through reciprocal giving.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes causality between ingestion and sacrifice; anupūrvaśaḥ traces the sequential necessity of compensatory offering. Responsibility is proportionate to the agent’s sustained engagement with the life-energy cycle. No punitive intent inheres—only completion of the causal loop necessary for cosmic integrity and individual purification.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate prāṇa-pratipūraṇa process until correct offering is made
Deploy śuddhi-vyavasthāpana council to oversee transfer of restitution
Activate antaḥkaraṇa-parīkṣa protocol for consciousness recalibration
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority: This law restores Dharma through reciprocal offering, aligning action with consciousness, affirming non-punitivity, and establishing reality as governed solely by causal completion under the eternal jurisdiction of awakened awareness.
